Package com.satvik.args

Interface Parser<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the target type into which strings are to be parsed
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Parser<T>
    This interface provides methods for parsing objects into one another. As this is a functional interface, one can create their own functions for parsing Strings into other objects via lambda expressions. For example : 
    
		.
		.
		.

		Parser<Integer> toInt = (s) -> (Integer.parseInt(s));
		
		.
		.
		.

		try {
			Integer i = toInt.parse("1");
		} catch (NumberFormatException e) {
			.
			.
			.
		}
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.1, 04/07/2016
    Author:
    Satvik Saha

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T parse(java.lang.String s)
      This method must be overriden in the implementing class, or can be used via lambda expressions.
      static <T> T parse(java.lang.String rawValue, java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      This method accepts a String to parse and the class of the target type.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        T parse(java.lang.String s)
 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method must be overriden in the implementing class, or can be used via lambda expressions. The implementation of parse(String) must return an object belonging to the type parameter used in the inherited class or the lambda expression declaration.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be parsed
        Returns:
        an object of the same type as the type parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if the implementation of this method throws an Exception
        Since:
        1.1

      • parse

        static <T> T parse(java.lang.String rawValue,
                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
            throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        This method accepts a String to parse and the class of the target type. It returns the parsed String in the form of T.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the target type
        Parameters:
        rawValue - the string to be parsed
        clazz - the class of the target type - use T.class
        Returns:
        the converted string in the form of T
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown if the target class is not recognized
        Since:
        1.0
